title: Pc going vroom
body:
Champ select makes it consume quite a bit of memory and my ever silent cpu fan starts spinning like crazy going vroom, oddly enough this didn't happen before O.o and I've been playing with the new client ever since ranked was enable on the beta test

It also goes back to being quiet after the game launches but while people is selecting and stuff it's all vroom vroom, any ideas?

replies.body: Your title made me giggle xD

It sounds like your PC may be having some heat issues. I'd recommend cleaning out any vents and ensure your hardware can properly breathe.

If you have any other questions, let me know.

uh... I seem to have mispoken here, my pc doesn't do this with any other program at any other stage, I'm an illustrator and I work with photoshop and Illustrator plus several other programs at the same time, those consume a TON more resources than what league does and my fans don't tend to make any sounds, not to mention, my cpu is a gaming one so it has holes everywhere, I also have 2 more fans in there just in case and my pc is at a stable 45 degrees most of the time...

This happens ONLY with league during champ select, see, the irony here is that the game itself should consume more resources and while I'm in-game my pc is perfectly silent, this is exclusive to champ select since the last patch

Does this happen in both the Legacy Client **and** the Beta Client? I'd like you to test both in a custom match to see if there's a difference. You can access the Legacy Client from login:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/215576628/Launch-Legacy-Client.jpg

Let me know if you saw any changes.

yep, the old client doesn't turn my fans into turbines

it's also nothing too serious for me, I mean my pc can definitely take it but a pc with finicky ventilation and voltage clock might find trouble while trying to launch a game I think... if that happens to every pc that is ._. as far as I can tell though, it's the new client's animations even though the only way I have for my pc to start making noticeable noises is to renderize in real time, I play Paragon in high settings with minimum noticeable noise... so... go figure :S

Thanks for confirming this only has been happening in the new client. If the animations are causing issues, you could try enabling *low spec mode* and disable *animation*. You can find these settings from the cog icon in the top-right corner of the client. I've included a screenshot of where these settings are:

http://image.prntscr.com/image/598e949fe2904c85b3220875cf13760f.png

I'd be interested to see if this changes anything with your symptoms.

ok... this is gonna be a weird answer xD, yes it does reduce the noise but... not completely? like the fans aren't going VROOM but vrm xDDDDDDD there's still a small increase in speed that's not usual? but yeah it does work O.o

edit: I digress ._. for custom games yeah, my pc is pretty quiet, for real champ select it's turbine all over again O.o, weird.

Gotcha. Since the new client is still in Beta, weird interactions like this are bound to happen. I recommend reporting this behavior on our [**Client Discussion Boards**](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion) so we can track this. You can continue to use the Legacy Client for now if you'd like to avoid this behavior in champ select.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
